title: Angular Build & Deployment
subject: Angular
theory: Building for production optimizes the app. AOT (Ahead-of-Time) compilation compiles templates during build. Tree Shaking removes unused code. Environments allow distinct configs for Dev, Staging, and Prod.

examples.explanation: Angular replaces environment.ts with environment.prod.ts during production build.

interview_questions.question: Difference between AOT and JIT?
interview_questions.answer: JIT (Just-in-Time) compiles in the browser (slower start). AOT compiles at build time (faster start, smaller bundle, earlier error detection).

summary: Proper build configuration ensures the app is small, fast, and secure for end users.
